H0.text: Plain unglazed pottery is often termed as what. Earthenware

H1.text: Plain unglazed pottery is often termed as what. Clayware

H2.text: Plain unglazed pottery is often termed as what. Ceramics

H3.text: Plain unglazed pottery is often termed as what. Terracota

A4.text: Earthenware is glazed or unglazed nonvitreous pottery that has normally been fired below 1,200 °C (2,190 °F).

A5.text: Basic earthenware, often called terracotta, absorbs liquids such as water.

A6.text: Digital Version of 'A Representation of the manufacturing of earthenware' — 1827 text on the manufacture of earthenware
